answers.answer: Hi there.There is indeed an artery that anatomically and normally courses in this area, and for someone with prominent blood vessels, this can cause visible pulsations.  This is of no cause of concern if the rest of your body is healthy, and is not suffering from any systemic diseases such as hypertension, diabetes, or heart conditions.  I suggest you report to your doctors any more problems that you may notice.Regards and God bless.

Thanks for the info - sometimes i feel like i am losing it - i am always dizzy - i thnik it is stress related - i just keep thinking i am at the end and i am quite young - been recently put on celexa as well as bad asthma - hypothyroid - and stomach reflux so i am living a prescription drug life which sucks - i just wish i could get rid of the dizziness - thanks for getting back to me

question: Good Day - I can see my pulse running through my hand in between my thumb and fingers - is this normal - i have very large veins (quite ugly actually)  should i be concerned about this - i can feel the pulse as well and i can not see one in the left hand at the same spotThanks
title: pulse
